definitions: activity or quality of giving satisfaction or enjoyment to someone
examples: The pleasing of customers is their top priority
His constant pleasing of others left him exhausted

definitions: ordinary person lacking aristocratic status or refinement
examples: The plebeians had limited political rights in ancient Rome
He was proud to be a plebeian rather than nobility

definitions: vote by all eligible citizens on important public question or constitutional change requiring popular approval
examples: The government held a plebiscite on independence
Citizens overwhelmingly supported the proposal in the plebiscite

definitions: small flat piece of plastic or similar material used to pluck strings
examples: She dropped her plectrum during the guitar solo
The bassist prefers a thick plectrum for deeper tones

definitions: serious promise or agreement to do or give something
item given as security for loan or payment
examples: The students recited the pledge of allegiance
She made a pledge to donate to charity monthly
He left his watch as a pledge for the loan
The pledge was returned when the debt was paid

definitions: large extinct marine reptile with paddle-like limbs and long neck that lived during the Mesozoic era
examples: The plesiosaur fossil was discovered in coastal cliffs
Museums display plesiosaur skeletons to show prehistoric marine life

definitions: large or excessive amount of something often more than needed or wanted
examples: The restaurant offers a plethora of menu options
A plethora of emails flooded her inbox daily

definitions: painful inflammation of membrane surrounding lungs causing sharp chest pain when breathing
examples: The doctor diagnosed her chest pain as pleurisy
Pleurisy can make deep breathing extremely painful

definitions: complex network of nerves or blood vessels branching and rejoining in body
examples: The solar plexus contains many important nerve connections
Damage to the brachial plexus affects arm movement

definitions: hand tool with two hinged arms ending in jaws for gripping objects
examples: Use pliers to pull out the bent nail
The electrician always carries needle-nose pliers

definitions: dangerous or unfortunate situation that someone finds themselves in
examples: The plight of refugees touched hearts worldwide
No one understood her financial plight until recently

definitions: heavy base supporting column or statue typically square or rectangular
examples: The marble statue stood on a granite plinth
Each column rests on a decorated stone plinth

definitions: act of moving or progressing slowly but steadily
examples: His plodding through the textbook took all semester
The plodding of the oxen continued throughout the day

definitions: person who secretly plans something illegal or harmful
computer output device that draws lines on paper
examples: The plotters met secretly to plan the overthrow
Police arrested all the plotters before they could act
The architect used a plotter for precise blueprints
Our plotter can print drawings up to A0 size

definitions: large farming tool pulled by animals or tractor to turn soil
examples: The farmer repaired his plough before spring planting
Ancient ploughs were made entirely of wood

definitions: process of turning over soil with plough to prepare for planting
examples: Spring ploughing begins when the ground thaws
The ploughing of the field took two full days

definitions: large farming tool pulled by animals or tractor to turn soil
examples: The tractor pulled the plow through the field
Snow plows cleared the roads after the blizzard

definitions: process of turning over soil with plow to prepare for planting
examples: Early morning plowing helps avoid the midday heat
The plowing must finish before the rains begin

definitions: person who operates plow to prepare fields for planting
examples: The plowman started work at dawn each day
An experienced plowman can create perfectly straight furrows

definitions: clever plan or action designed to gain advantage
examples: Her question was just a ploy to change topics
The discount offer was a marketing ploy

definitions: spirited courage and determination in difficult circumstances
examples: It took real pluck to start her own business
The team showed pluck despite being behind

definitions: device for making electrical connection by insertion into socket
piece of material used to block hole or gap
examples: The lamp plug doesn't fit this outlet properly
Always check the plug before using electrical appliances
Use a rubber plug to stop the bathtub drain
The dentist placed a temporary plug in the cavity

definitions: oval fleshy fruit with smooth skin and central stone
something desirable especially job or position
examples: Fresh plums are sweetest in late summer
She made plum jam from the garden harvest
That professorship is a real plum job
He landed the plum role in the movie

definitions: complete covering of feathers on bird often distinctive in color and pattern
examples: The peacock displayed its brilliant plumage to attract mates
Winter plumage helps birds blend with snowy surroundings

definitions: weight attached to line used to determine vertical direction
examples: Builders use a plumb to ensure walls are vertical
The plumb showed the post was leaning slightly

definitions: skilled worker who installs and repairs water pipes and fixtures
examples: Call a plumber to fix the leaking faucet
The plumber replaced all the old copper pipes

definitions: system of pipes and fixtures for water supply and drainage
work or trade of installing and maintaining pipe systems
examples: The house needs new plumbing throughout
Old plumbing can cause water pressure problems
She studied plumbing at the technical college
His plumbing business serves the entire county

definitions: large feather used as decoration especially on hat or helmet
column of smoke or vapor rising into air
examples: The general's helmet bore a red plume
Ostrich plumes decorated the Victorian lady's hat
A plume of smoke rose from the chimney
The volcanic plume was visible for miles

definitions: weight attached to line used for measuring water depth
examples: Sailors used a plummet to check water depth
The plummet indicated dangerous shallow waters ahead

definitions: state of being pleasantly fat or rounded in form
examples: The baby's plump was considered healthy and adorable
The plump of the cushions made them very comfortable

definitions: goods stolen by force especially during war or riot
examples: Pirates divided the plunder from the captured ship
The museum returned plunder taken during colonial times

definitions: act of stealing goods by force especially during conflict
examples: The plundering of the city lasted three days
Vikings were known for their plundering of coastal towns

definitions: sudden fall or dive especially into water
decisive action taken after hesitation
examples: The plunge from the cliff was breathtaking
Stock prices took a plunge after the announcement
Their plunge into business proved very successful
Taking the plunge into marriage changed their lives

definitions: rubber suction device on handle for clearing blocked drains
part that moves up and down in cylinder or mechanism
examples: Use the plunger to unclog the kitchen sink
Every bathroom should have a plunger handy
The syringe plunger pushes medicine through the needle
Press the plunger to dispense the soap

definitions: word form denoting more than one person or thing
examples: The plural of mouse is mice in English
Students must learn irregular plural forms

definitions: system allowing existence of different groups with distinct beliefs cultures or interests within society
examples: Religious pluralism promotes tolerance between different faiths
Political pluralism ensures multiple parties can compete

definitions: person who believes in or promotes system allowing diverse groups to coexist
examples: As a pluralist, she supported multicultural education policies
The pluralist argued for protecting minority viewpoints

definitions: number of votes exceeding any other but not majority
state of being plural or consisting of multiple parts
examples: The candidate won by plurality rather than majority
A plurality of voters supported the new policy
The plurality of opinions enriched the debate
Cultural plurality defines modern urban societies

definitions: rich fabric with long soft nap resembling velvet
examples: The theater seats were covered in red plush
She bought plush fabric for the cushion covers

definitions: highly radioactive metallic element used in nuclear weapons and reactors produced artificially from uranium
examples: Plutonium requires extremely careful handling due to radiation
The reactor produces plutonium as a byproduct

definitions: single thickness or layer of material
regular journey along fixed route
examples: This rope has three-ply construction for strength
Use two-ply toilet paper for better quality
The ferry's daily ply connects the two islands
Taxi drivers know every ply in the city

definitions: board made of thin layers of wood glued together with grain alternating
examples: Marine plywood resists water damage better than regular wood
The contractor used plywood for the subfloor

definitions: infection causing inflammation of lungs with symptoms including cough fever and breathing difficulty
examples: The elderly patient developed pneumonia after surgery
Pneumonia can be caused by bacteria or viruses

definitions: medical condition where air enters space between lung and chest wall causing lung collapse
examples: The accident victim suffered a pneumothorax requiring immediate treatment
Spontaneous pneumothorax can occur without apparent cause

definitions: person who hunts or catches animals illegally on another's property
shallow pan designed for poaching eggs or fish
examples: Rangers arrested the elephant poacher in the reserve
Poachers threaten many endangered species worldwide
Use the egg poacher for perfectly shaped breakfast eggs
The fish poacher allows gentle cooking in liquid

definitions: illegal hunting or fishing on someone else's property
cooking method using simmering liquid
examples: Wildlife poaching has decimated rhino populations
Heavy fines discourage poaching on private land
Poaching salmon keeps it moist and flavorful
Egg poaching requires precise water temperature

definitions: elongated seed case of legumes that splits to release seeds
small group of whales or similar marine mammals
examples: Pea pods should be picked when still tender
The vanilla pod contains tiny black seeds
A pod of dolphins swam alongside the boat
The whale pod stayed together during migration

definitions: digital audio file available for downloading typically as series on particular topic
examples: Her true crime podcast has millions of subscribers
I listen to educational podcasts during my commute

definitions: raised platform for speaker or conductor to stand on
platform for top three finishers in competition
examples: The speaker approached the podium to begin her address
The conductor stood on the podium facing the orchestra
Three athletes stood on the podium for medals
She reached the podium in every race this season
